title: Engineering Manager, User Billing
content:
Who we are
About Stripe
Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies—from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups—use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone’s reach while doing the most important work of your career.
About the team
Stripe’s infrastructure powers businesses all over the world. We process payments, run marketplaces, detect fraud, help entrepreneurs start an internet business from anywhere in the world, build world-class developer-friendly APIs, and more.
User Billing provides a central entry point for Stripe products to monetize in global markets. It is ultimately responsible for the systems, programs, and operations that generate Stripe’s revenue and the economic models we have with our customers. This is accomplished through a sophisticated pricing onboarding tooling and workflow management, unified billing engine, and custom solutions for our largest enterprise users. 
Our work is core to Stripe’s business. Millions of customers look at us for a reliable and frictionless billing experience with Stripe.
Technical Operations roles are a dynamic and key component of Stripe’s success. Focused on serving Stripe customers, we sit at the intersection of product, sales, engineering, finance, and operations, acting as the connective tissues that ensure internal and external users receive user billing results accurately and timely. 
What you’ll do
Responsibilities

Collaborate across the company, including engineering, accounting, sales, financial partnerships and product teams, to analyze and account for billions of dollars moving through the Stripe platform
Help influence peers / managers and build consensus while dealing with ambiguity
Drive data and process efficiencies to meet the scale and speed of Stripe
Build your team - formalizing role definitions, defining charter and ownership boundaries and taking a newly formed team into a high-functioning one
Work daily with product, engineering, and sales teams to find and solve issues, and drive engineering to improve their systems

Who you are
We’re looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.
Minimum requirements

Have 3+ years of people management experience 
Have 5-10 years of experience in a technical role (e.g. Technical Operations, Technical Program Management, Software Engineering, Data Science, etc.)
Strong customer service focus, with the ability to communicate and build relationships with technical and non-technical teams across internal and external stakeholders 
Have experience navigating the nuanced complexity of financial systems and solving large scale, technical challenges
Have strong analytical skills to investigate, prioritize, and identify the root cause of issues

Preferred qualifications

Technical/product expertise (how to get upstream configuration right, how to plug downstream teams into product development, deep understanding of product/engineering requirements)
Data integrity expertise (reconciliation and manual data management, data quality assessment, data and reporting efficiency)
Operational expertise (measuring/improving manual processes, motivating/engaging an operations team)

values.label: I am not interested in office-based opportunities

questions.description: Stripe is currently operating in a hybrid work environment. In-office expectations for office-assigned Stripes vary by team. A remote location, in most cases, is defined as living 50 miles or more from an office location. While you would be welcome to join the office for team or business meetings when necessary, the expectation would be that you would regularly work from home rather than a Stripe office location. Stripe offices are located in Amsterdam, Bangkok, Bengaluru, Berlin, Chicago, Dubai, Dublin, Jakarta, London, Madrid, Mexico City, New York City, Paris, São Paulo, Singapore, South San Francisco, Seattle, Tokyo, and Toronto. Stripe does not cover the cost of relocating to a remote location. We encourage you to apply for roles that match the location in which you live or have intentions to live.
questions.label: If this role offers the option to work from a remote location, do you plan to work remotely?

values.label: Yes, I intend to work remotely.
No, I intend to work from an office location.
